subject: Creativity
title: Originality Doesn't Exist: Everything Is a Remix
description: Learn Originality Doesn't Exist: Everything Is a Remix in one minute.

hook.text: Star Wars is Kurosawa's Hidden Fortress in space. The Lion King is Hamlet with lions.

buildup.text: Kirby Ferguson's 'Everything Is a Remix' thesis: all creative work builds on existing elements through copy, transform.

discovery.text: The printing press was a remix of the wine press and coin punch.

twist.text: Demanding 'originality' paralyzes creators. When you accept that all creation is recombination, you stop waiting for a.

climax.text: The most 'original' works are just the ones that combine existing elements in ways nobody had tried before.

punchline.text: Originality is a myth. Creativity is the art of combining what exists into what.

quiz.question: According to Kirby Ferguson, how does creative work develop?
options: Through copying, transforming, and combining existing elements
